HAT Alella Tour

Live and authentic experience of the 19th century!
Days & Duration

Tuesday and Thursday. The tour has a duration of 6 hours approx

Meeting Point

Catalonia Square in front of Hard Rock Cafe at 9.30 am. There will be someone wearing an orange hat

Languages available

English, French, Spanish and Catalan

People

Max. 20 - Min. 6

TAKE A CITY BREAK FROM BARCELONA TO VISIT ALELLA AND ITS NEIGHBORING WINERY

On this tour you will have a unique experience that let you know how the Catalan bourgeoisie lived in Alella during the 19th century. Alella is a small charming village located in the comarca of Maresme, between the Mediterranean Sea and the coastal mountain range named Serralada del Litoral. It is also well known for its wine production & valley vineyards, just 15km away from Barcelona. This wonderful tour will provide knowledgement about Catalan history, culture, gastronomy and it is perfect to be close to local people. HAT Barcelona finds it to be the ideal experience for the nature-loving people that needs a quick recharge from the hustle-and-bustle of the city!

Itinerary

With icon of without icon and with nice button



Bouquet d'Alella

The first activity will be done in a typical farmhouse of the 14th century, surrounded by vineyards. Bouquet is a small, family-run winery that offers a small production of wines made from mostly local grapes grown over thirteen hectares of land. You will visit the cellar and the vineyards. Finally you will taste four organic and high quality wines.



Modernist Walking Tour

The tour is much more than a series of photo opportunities (although don't forget your camera!). Dig deep into the roots of the movement and explore the social unrest, political and cultural issues. The result is a memorable one of the most important art of the world and a tribute to some of its most talented artists.



Local Market

During this walking tour we â€˜ll make a stop at the Local Market of Alella, which opened its doors in X, you will learn about locally grown products, get to know some of the vendors who have been there for years. This casual stop is for you to savour typical gastronomic heritage from a local perspective.



Vermouth Time

Vermouth is more than a simple drink, it is a beautiful tradition. Enjoy a typical Spanish vermouth and tapas in a truly authentic Catalan Tavern, which opened its doors 27 years ago. Discover the tavern that has become reference as a traditional place to take vermouth in the middle of this special village.

MENU

Remember our Meeting Point

Catalonia Square in front of Hard Rock Cafe at 9.30 am. There will be someone wearing an orange hat
